text:
Apache could be configured to identify OpenDocument files and flag them with their own icon like it 
does with TeX, compressed files and a few others.  This means a small GIF and/or PNG plus a change to 
the http.config

e.g. something like this (or whatever is more appropriate)  :

     AddIcon /icons/opendocumentfile.gif .odt .ods .odp .odg .odc \
     .odf .odb .odi .odm
     
     AddIcon /icons/opendocumenttemplate.gif .ott .ots .otp .otg \
     .otc .otf .oti 

The full list of file extensions and mime types can be found in "Appendix C.MIME Types and File Name 
Extensions (Non Normative)" of the OpenDocument specification at URL: 
    http://www.oasis-open.org/committees/download.php/12572/OpenDocument-v1.0-os.pdf

This is more a feature request for the httpd.config file, plus a tiny icon.  However, it would be nice to 
have since most productivity suites support or plan in the near future to support the format
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenDocument#Current_support
